###Randomization Tests
```{r}
# 1. Define univariate metric X 
# 2. Calculate X for observed data Xobs
# 3. Randomize data, subject to some constraints (baseline like Hardy Weinberg)
# 4. Calculate X for randomized data Xsim
# 5. Repeat step 4 many times (~ n = 1000); generate a distribution of Xsim, visualized as a histogram for H0
# hypothesize specific patterns 
# 6. Compare Xobs to Xsim; estimate a tail distribution; P(Xobs | H0)
# 7. Draw biological inference, conclusions 

#Motivating Example; compare ant species richness among different New England ecotypes

data <- read.table(file = "antcountydata.csv", header = TRUE, sep=",", stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

data$ecoregion <- as.factor(data$ecoregion)
boxplot(data$n.species~data$ecoregion, col="indianred")
myModel <- aov(n.species~data$ecoregion, data=data)
summary(myModel)

#get closer to idea of probability
#re-do analysis using a randomization test; same answer qualtitatively, but using different route

#define response metric 
#use variance among treatment means as X


##################################################################################################
# FUNCTION: VarMeans
# calculates variance among a group of treatment means 
# Input: vector of groups, vector of groups means 
# Output: among group variance of means 
# ________________________________________________________________________________________________
VarMeans <- function(fac=NULL, res=runif(25)) {
  if(is.null(fac)){
    fac <- as.factor(rep(LETTERS[1:5], each=5))
  }
  temp <- aggregate(x=res, by=list(fac), FUN=mean)
  return(var(temp$x)) #one number that will come back
  # OR return(var(temp[,2]))
  }
VarMeans()

#want to specify randomization, to form an appropriate null hypothesis 
#randomization = reshuffle ecotype labels --> will preserve any differences in sample size 

##################################################################################################
# FUNCTION: TreatRan
# randomize treatment (factor) labels
# Input: vector of observed treatment labels
# Output: vector of randomized treatment labels
# ________________________________________________________________________________________________
TreatRan <- function(fac=NULL) {
  if(is.null(fac)){
    fac <- as.factor(rep(LETTERS[1:5], each=5))
  }
fac <- sample(fac, replace=FALSE)
return(fac)
}
TreatRan()

#now write function for summary and plots

##################################################################################################
# FUNCTION: randomizeSummary
# give summary stats boxplots, and histogram plot
# Input: vector of simulated values, observed value
# Output: list of null model statistics, graphs 
# ________________________________________________________________________________________________
randomizeSummary <- function(obsX=runif(1), 
                             simX=runif(1000),
                             fac=NULL,
                             res=runif(25)){
  if(is.null(fac)){
    fac <- as.factor(rep(LETTERS[1:5], each = 5))
  }
  
  pLow <- mean(simX <= obsX)
  pHigh <- mean(simX >= obsX)
  meanSimX <- mean(simX)
  varSimX <- var(simX)
  SES <- (obsX - mean(simX))/sd(simX)
  
  outList <- list(stats=list(obsX=obsX, 
                             meanSimX=meanSimX, 
                             varSimX=varSimX,
                             pLow=pLow, 
                             pHigh=pHigh, 
                             SES=SES,
                             reps=length(simX)),
                             raw=simX)
                  
  par(mfrow=c(1, 3))
  
  #show boxplot of real data 
  boxplot(res~fac, col="indianred")
  mtext("Observed Data", side = 3, font=2, cex=0.75)
  
  #show boxplot of simulated data
  boxplot(res~sample(fac), col="goldenrod")
  mtext("Simulated Data", side = 3, font=2, cex=0.75)
  
  #show histogram of simulated and observed values
  
  hist(simX, breaks=25,
       col="goldenrod", 
       main="Null Distribution", 
       xlab="Simulated Response", 
       xlim=c(0, max(c(simX,obsX))))
  Interval95 <- quantile(x=simX, probs=c(0.05, 0.95))
  Interval975 <- quantile(x=simX, probs=c(0.025, 0.975))
  abline(v=obsX, col="indianred", lwd=2)
  abline(v=Interval95, col="black", lwd=2, lty="dotted")
  abline(v=Interval975, col="black", lwd=2, lty="dashed")
  par(mfrow=c(1,1))
  
  return(outList)
}
z <- randomizeSummary()
```
